results.title: The Mammalian heart
results.creator_credit: A K Lee, D Moyan, Australian Academy of Science and Educational Media International
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “The Web of life”.
Illustrates the structure and functioning of the mammalian heart by using the hearts of a sheep and a dog as examples. The sheep’s heart is used to show external features and internal structure, while the appearance of a living heart is seen during a chest operation on a dog at a veterinary clinic. The passage of blood through the heart, lungs and major vessels is observed through X-ray process. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: A K Lee, D Moyan, Australian Academy of Science and Educational Media International

results.title: The Living mountains
results.creator_credit: Richard Brock, British Broadcasting Corporation and British Petroleum
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Web of life”.
Looks at some of the strange plants seen on a journey from the shores of the Caribbean in Venezuela to the moorlands and peaks of the Andes Mountains, then across the world to Mount Kenya, with its weird giant plants and tiny sunbirds. Shows how plants and animals survive in extreme conditions and also indicates that today the seemingly invulnerable mountains are less secure from human intrusion.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Brock, British Broadcasting Corporation and British Petroleum

results.title: The Living river
results.creator_credit: Richard Brock, British Broadcasting Corporation and British Petroleum
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Web of life”.
Thoughtless actions by humans can easily upset the delicately adjusted balance of life in a river. Shows how the seasons, weather, flora and fauna of the River Test are all integrated and woven into a “web of life”. Includes underwater shots of birds feeding from the river bed and thousands of eels on migration.

results.title: The Living lakes
results.creator_credit: Richard Brock, British Broadcasting Corporation and British Petroleum
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Web of life”.
A study of the ecology of the lakes which form a part of the Great Rift Valley in Kenya. Each lake in this dramatic valley has its own “web of life” with each species adapted to the local conditions. Among the string of lakes examined there is great contrast, ranging from the 150 degree fahrenheight soda flats of Lake Magadi to the clear waters of Lake Naivasha with its abundance of pink lilies.
